name: Cavalcade of Classic Romantic Dramas Quiz / Test | Movies | 10 Questions

questions.text: Unrequited Love: The classic in this genre may be 'Of Human Bondage'. Leslie Howard (the protagonist in the best version of the movie) is hung up on young Bette Davis. What are his two other interests?
questions.explanation:
Medicine, Art.

	He's a medical student who also has an interest in painting. His infatuation with Davis (and her indifference to him) prove costly in this tale by Somerset Maugham. (The movie was remade with Laurence Harvey and Kim Novak.)

questions.text: Divorce: 'Kramer vs. Kramer' is one of the better movies about a marriage gone south. It's a custody fight: with whom does the child end up living at the end of the movie?
questions.explanation:
Dustin Hoffman.

	Hoffman and Streep are the parents. Clayburgh starred in another divorce drama: 'An Unmarried Woman'. Douglas starred in 'War of the Roses'.

questions.text: Crime of Passion: 'The Letter' begins with Bette Davis shooting - repeatedly - a 'friend'; we learn why as the movie unfolds. Who wrote the story?
Family Conflict: Which of the following movies includes Judd Hirsch in the cast?
questions.explanation:
'Ordinary People'.

	All are 'family conflict' movies. Hirsch played the psychiatrist in 'Ordinary People' about a family in turmoil. 'Cat' also involved multiple family conflicts. 'Pierce' featured a mother-daughter conflict betweeen Joan Crawford and Ann Blyth. 'Father' involved a father-son conflict between Gene Hackman and Melvyn Douglas.

questions.text: Classic Tragedy: 'Affair to Remember' is the best of this genre, with Cary Grant and Deborah Kerr as two lovers. Who played the other man who was also romantically interested in Kerr?
questions.explanation:
Richard Denning.

	Milland was Ryan O'Neal's father in 'Love Story', the quintessential tale of a doomed relationship.

questions.text: Complicated Relationships: 'The Graduate'. (What's more complicated than a man becoming involved with both a girl and her mother?) Who played the hotel clerk where Hoffman and Bancroft met for their trysts?
questions.explanation:
Buck Henry.

	Daniels played Hoffman's father. Hamilton played Mr. Robinson. Fell played the operator of the housing facility near the college attended by Katharine Ross. (Richard Dreyfuss also had a bit part in the movie.)

questions.text: Romance Complicated By Business: 'The Verdict' has lawyer Paul Newman getting involved with a scheming woman who is in league with his adversaries. Who plays the woman?
questions.explanation:
Charlotte Rampling.

	Field starred with Newman in 'Absence of {Malice';} Dillon was also in the movie. Laurie was in 'Hustler' with Newman.

questions.text: Bizarre Relationships: 'Tootsie' involves a romance - but things aren't what they seem. Who plays the man who is interested in Tootsie?
questions.explanation:
Charles Durning.

	Some romances simply can't work out - no matter what you try to do.

questions.text: Romantic Triangle: 'The Postman Always Rings Twice' is perhaps the best in this category. How did John Garfield and Lana Turner first try to kill Turner's husband?
questions.explanation:
Kill Him In The Bathtub.

	The train bit comes from 'Double Indemnity'.

questions.text: Happily Ever After: 'The Apartment' has Jack Lemmon pursuing Shirley Maclaine throughout the movie - and winning her in the end. Who was one of the business associates of Lemmon's who used his apartment?
questions.explanation:
Ray Walston.

	Jacobi was in a different Lemmon and Maclaine movie: 'Irma La Douce'.
